headline.seo: Low-Calorie Diet Doesn’t Prolong Life, Study of Monkeys Finds
headline.print_headline: Eat Up: Skin-and-Bones Diet Fails to Extend Monkeys’ Lives
headline.main: Severe Diet Doesn’t Prolong Life, at Least in Monkeys

docs.abstract: Long-running study published online in journal Nature finds rhesus monkeys whose caloric intake was restricted by 30 percent did not live any longer than their normal-weight peers; causes of death--cancer and heart disease--were the same in both the underfed and normally fed monkeys.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a long-running study, rhesus monkeys whose caloric intake was restricted by 30 percent didn’t live any longer than their normal-weight peers.
docs.snippet: In a long-running study, rhesus monkeys whose caloric intake was restricted by 30 percent didn’t live any longer than their normal-weight peers.
